title: Album Page, "Sketches of Architectural Details", September 14, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, from top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 44 / 56;  Forsbach / Valley of the Murg / Black Forest / Sept 14th 1887; a curious corner addition; shingles / Murg Valley Sept 14th 1887 / Murg; Ratstadt / Sept 14th 1887.
description: Vertical sheet illustrating five sketches of buildings or architectural elements.  Beginning at top left is a simple, timber-frame structure with steeple in the center of the main façade.  The eaves are ornamented with bargeboard decoration underneath.  At top right is a small ogee canopy over an open casement window.  The canopy appears to be tiled.  This small sketch is identified by the artist as "Forsbach / Valley of the Murg / Black Forest".  At center is a half-timbered building with steeply pitched roof, and the artist has noted a small addition to the corner of the building which is prominently supported by large timbers underneath.  At lower right is a small tower with faceted onion dome cupola and four-sided finial or weathervane.  The drawing at lower left is much larger than the others, and illustrates a shingeled, timber-frame structure with two story tower completed by a tiled steeple with ball finial surmounted by a cross.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Sketches of Architectural Details", September 14, 1887.
September 14, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-124.
